content: - install importexporttools addon if not already done - click Local Folders' and rightclick and create new folder for each folder to recover - highlight one of the new folders, rightclick and select importexport menu option to import mbox and the select of of the folders (IGNORE the msf entries) - repeat for each folder - now, you have recovered the messages. if you want to merge them into another Local folder or into a POP folder, you can repeat the process, somewhat, by highlighting each of the new folders, rightclick and select importexport option to export as eml - then, click the receiving folder, rightclick and select to import eml and that will merge the messages.
creator: davidsk

content: here is how i do it: - exit thunderbird on old PC - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external media (this assumes you use default installation) - on new PC, install thunderbird and exit - copy the backed-up thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the existing thunderbird folder - start thunderbird

content:
As you were told in your previous two threads like https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1453607

Thunderbird is a email client installed on your Windows system as It is Not a server or email service.

Perhaps your email provider(s) is having issues so you need to find out from them. Your provider would be the one after the @ like for example @gmail.com @comcast.net @yahoo.com etc.

Also this is a public community forum and nobody here will be calling or texting you at some random posted phone#.

So you know, to reply in a forum thread that is not locked, scroll down to the Post a Reply box, then type in your reply, then click on the Post Reply.

Locking this one as we do not need yet another thread asking the same question.

content:
Per quanto ne so l'accesso ai servizi email di TIM (Tim, Tin, Alice) tramite client è possibile solo se si è clienti TIM. Vedi: -> https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/client-pc

Puoi accedere alla tua TIM Mail sia da webmail che da Client di posta (Gmail, Outlook,...) se: - hai una mail @tim.it @alice.it @tin.it associata a una linea attiva TIM fissa o mobile - hai una mail @tim.it @alice.it @tin.it non associata a una linea attiva TIM fissa o mobile ma sei connesso alla rete TIM fissa o mobile. L’accesso alla mail con Operatore diverso da TIM è consentito solo tramite webmail.

content:
@sfhowes : thanks. I deleted "mail\smart mailboxes" and "virtualFolders.dat". Result: When restarting TB, all virtual tags folders (VTF) appear. So I thought, this would have solved the problem ... But then, I restarted TB again and some VTF have disappeared. So basically the problem is "solved" for one session, but TB doesn't "remember" it.

1) tag count before "resetting Unified folders": 11 2) tag count after "resetting Unified folders" + restarting: 15 (100%) 3) tag count after restarting TB again: 11 4) tag count after restarting TB again: 11

What could be the culprit ?
creator: welcome

content: Not sure of the cause, but when things like this change, my first idea is that there's an external app that acts on TB and resets settings between sessions. The classic example is CCleaner that is well known to do this unless TB is excluded. Make sure when you delete the smart mailboxes folder and the dat file that TB is closed.
creator: sfhowes

creator: charlotte.lehr

content:
charlotte.lehr said

david said
what error message are you receiving when using smtp.office365.com and oauth2?

I don't get an error-message. I just don't get my e-mail. It gets stuck in this step (see screenshot) and after like maybe 20 or 30 seconds, it will just give up and not display this anymore and also will not have retrieved my e-mail.

SMTP is for outgoing mail it should not affect you receiving mail, in fact the only time it should attempt to contact the SMTP server is while sending an email... can you be certain that SMTP is the issue with accessing your mail? Because that would be a POP/IMAP issue.

So here's my experience:

After updating my authentication method to OAuth2 and IMAP Server Name to outlook.office365.com, TB forced a restart on the app and I was prompted by a live.com website login and then requested permission and it successfully retrieved my mail. Left the SMTP Server Name alone as that is what was stated on the MS website, TB wouldn't let me change to OAuth2 tho so left that as mozilla article found in this tread said to basic authentication. After having responded to this thread I tried to test sending an email, failed authentication. Changed SMTP Server Name to smtp.office365.com closed window re-opened and OAuth2 was now available and switched to that. Tried to test sending again, failed again. Since TB did not force restart after the SMTP server change I decided to do that myself before trying anything else. Attempted to send again and this time succeeded.

Microsoft really needs to update their info on the proper SMTP server to use and the mozilla article needs to make mention of the server names needing to be changed and not just the authentication method...
creator: C45P3R

content: I used Groupwise 20+ years ago and don't remember well. Do you see all 11,000 online? Do you also see all 11,000 in Thunderbird? There are no limits here, and many users have many more. If you can see them within your thunderbird account, I feel they will download.
creator: davidsk

content: - GroupWise Sent items holds 11,176 (both in the full client and GW-web) - Thunderbird only shows the initial 4,000 elements. I just tested by creating an additional Thunderbird account with the same result: Folders exceeding 4,000 items are not fully accessible from Thunderbird Thanks
creator: claus36

content:
david said
I used Groupwise 20+ years ago and don't remember well. Do you see all 11,000 online? Do you also see all 11,000 in Thunderbird? There are no limits here, and many users have many more. If you can see them within your thunderbird account, I feel they will download.

OK, so - it was a GroupWise GWIA setting: Default ‑‑imapreadlimit = 4,000.

I'm good - thanks

content:
First, I don't think it is a good choice, as you will have to move forward eventually, and now 128 is about to hit autoupdate. BUT, here is what you want: 

Try:    Exit Thunderbird if running.    click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

No there are folders and indexes that Thunderbird uses in it's processing.

Delete them and you will probably have to start by installing Thunderbird all over after you manually delete the profile you corrupted.

Why would you install Thunderbird in a folder of another application?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Well, donations are welcome, and we thank you for yours, and we hope you continue with periodic donations, as it is with regular donations that we sustain Thunderbird. Anyway, at settings>general, the first tickbox is for the welcome message. Unticking that should address your concerns. Thunderbird on your Mac is not aware of your kind donations and is designed there as a friendly reminder. Annoying you was never the intent. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Simple: Tools>Message Filters, "Match any of the following" From|ends with|.space (add a new entry for all top levels you would like to block), "Perform these actions" Delete Message.
